page.title: 05OSHWAL ASSOC. OF THE U.K.
page.content: The Hook was built by Benjamin Cherry in 1859 incorporating material from "Gobions" in Brookmans Park. From 1931 to 1980 it was owned by The Greyhound Racing Association who then sold it to The Oshwal Association of The U.K. the house at present is being modernised and refurbished by the Architect John F.Griffiths as a community centre for the Jains,an Indian religious sect who came mainly from East Africa.It is planned to organise the whole site around the house to make it the group's headquarters in Britain and planning consent has been obtained for Assembly Halls and eventually a small temple in the gardens. Most of the meetings of the sect take place in July,August and September and marriages are performed during these meetings.
